summary: Sub-Saharan Africa is the region south of the Sahara Desert, including Central, East, Southern, and West Africa. It has around 46-48 countries, depending on who is defining it. This area is separate from North Africa, which is part of the Arab world. The Sahara's harsh climate has been a barrier between these regions since ancient times. The term helps group countries with similar characteristics, but the exact countries included can vary between organizations.
title: Sub-Saharan Africa
